Authors:
Akihiko Kinoshita, Hiromi Sasaki, Takamichi Orihara,
Kazuhide Nara
Title:
Tuber iryudaensis and T. tomentosum: Two new truffles wrapped
by tomentose mycelium
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Biogeography, Ectomycorrhizal fungi, Edible
mushroom, Tuberaceae
Abstract:
We describe and illustrate two new truffle species, Tuber
iryudaensis and Tuber tomentosum by molecular and morphological
analyses. Both species are clearly distinguishable from other Tuber
species by ocher tomentose mycelia covering ascomata surface. Tuber
iryudaensis is characterized by having one-spored asci and a huge
ascospore with reddish brown color, while these microscopic characters
are similar to the related Chinese species. Tuber tomentosum forms one
to four ascospores per ascus with reddish brown color as T. macrosporum
and T. canaliculatum, although their spores are much smaller. Molecular
phylogenetic analyses based on ribosomal internal transcribed spacer and
partial large subunit sequences support that both species are distantly
related to known Tuber species within the Macrosporum group.
